item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There will be little rubs and disappointments everywhere, and we are all apt to expect too much; but then, if one scheme of happiness fails, human nature turns to another; if the first calculation is wrong, we make a second better: we find comfort somewhere." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You must learn some of my philosophy. Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Run mad as often as you choose, but do not faint!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikii add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"I had been fed, in my youth, a lot of old wives' tales about the way men would instantly forsake a beautiful woman to flock around a brilliant one. It is but fair to say that, after getting out in the world, I had never seen this happen."
[From a column dated November 17, 1928]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "In the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Nikii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am not at all in a humor for writing; I must write on till I am." -- Jane Austen
